name: himi's Plugin Organizer
author: himitsu

sections.description:
Plugins can be sorted into several groups and filtered accordingly.

Each plugin can be provided with a private comment.

In addition, a “details” link appears on each plug, through which you look at the corresponding page on
https://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/ appearance (if the plugin is hosted there),
just as the result of the plugins install page (wp-admin/plugin-install.php).

Licence

Good news, this plugin is free for everyone!
Since it’s released under the GPL, you can use it free of charge on your personal or commercial blog.
But if you enjoy this plugin, you can thank me and leave a small donation
for the time I’ve spent writing and supporting this plugin.
And I really don’t want to know how many hours of my life this plugin has already eaten ðŸ˜‰

Translations

The plugin comes with various translations, please refer to the
WordPress Codex
for more information about activating the translation. If you want to help to translate the plugin to your language,
please have a look at the .pot file which contains all defintions and may be used with a gettext
editor like Poedit (Windows) or plugin for WordPress Localization.
sections.installation:
Requirements

  • WordPress version 3.0 and later (tested at 3.0.5)

Installation

  1. Unpack the download-package
  2. Upload the file to the /plugins/ directory
  3. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress

Localizations

It is almost every translation available.
The integrated translation of the blog will be used.
sections.changelog:
v1.1b (21/02/2011)

  • small bugfix

v1.1 (20/02/2011)

  • security with current_user_can()
  • options page
  • plugin comments

v1.0 (17/02/2011)

  • base idea
